fields.summary: Allow iFrame Macro from Adaptavist to be visible on PDF Export

fields.description: When you have a Space set to use the Global look and feel theme, the hide sidebar button is missing. if you set the space to use the documentation theme for example, the button appears again.
fields.summary: Hide side bar button is missing when using the global look and feel theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28986].
  {panel}

h4. Background of Request

As of now, Confluence send out an e-mail of recommended updates according to the popularity of the content(s). This feature will search the whole Confluence instance and pick the most popular content based on votes and comments. Since this feature include the whole Confluence instance, there is a big possibility that Confluence missed important updates from spaces they have included as their favorite space(s). 

By having recommended updates for each user favorite space(s), Confluence user will get a more specific updates from their preferred content genre such as IT Department Space or Accounting Department Space.

h4. Proposed Implementation

I proposed, recommended updates per favorite space which can be configured, for example:

* Space A -- Recommended Updates -- Send out in Monday
* Space B -- Recommended Updates -- Send out in Wednesday

For example, a Confluence content regarding an event discussion such as dinner get more votes and comment compared with a procedure updates from talent department.
fields.summary: Recommended Updates Email for each Favorite Spaces

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
1. Create application link between Confluence and JIRA
2. Embed an iframe code in HTML macro and save the Confluence page
{code}
<iframe src="http://localhost:8528/jira/secure/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=10011&issuetype=6&Create=Create" width="720" height="720"></iframe>
{code}
3. Refresh the page

h4. Results
* Situation 1
** application link is set using *localhost*
** url used to access a Confluence page that has the iframe is using *localhost*
** iframe url is using *localhost*
** Result: All drop-down box doesn't work but the due date field worked
* Situation 2
** application link is set using *localhost*
** url used to access a Confluence page that has the iframe is using *localhost*
** iframe url is using *ip address*
** Result: All drop-down box worked but the due date field doesn't work
* Situation 3
** application link is set using *localhost*
** url used to access a Confluence page that has the iframe is using *ip address*
** iframe url is using *localhost*
** Result: All drop-down box worked but the due date field doesn't work
* Situation 4
** application link is set using *localhost*
** url used to access a Confluence page that has the iframe is using *ip address*
** iframe url is using *ip address*
** Result: All drop-down box doesn't work but the due date field worked

h4. Summary
This is a weird behavior that occurs between ip address and localhost usage.

h4. Affected Platform
Only Internet Explorer has this issue. Chrome does fine.
fields.summary: Certain fields does not respond when an iframe to create issue is embedded in a Confluence page
Labels List macro still shows labels that are in the space trash

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
1. Create application link from Confluence to JIRA 5.2.8
2. Create a Confluence page and embed the iframe code in a html macro (make sure its enabled)
{code}
<iframe src="http://localhost:8528/jira/secure/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=10011&issuetype=6&Create=Create" width="720" height="720"></iframe>
{code}
3. Save the Confluence page and click the drop-down box to change Project. YOu will see UI error there.

h4. Screenshot
!iframe.png!

h4. Affected platform
Only Mozilla Firefox seems to be affected. Error appeared on version 20.0.1. IE and Chrome is not affected.
fields.summary: UI error when using iframe in html macro to create issue on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28982].
  {panel}

Global Look and Feel Cannot be Applied to Individual Spaces when Documentation Theme is Set on Global.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# As default you're using the default documentation in the *Global Look and feel*
# Go to _Browse > Confluence Admin > Themes_ and change to *Documentation theme*
# Now go to a space, that you're sure that has the *Global Look and feel* theme.
# You'll see that the theme was changed.
# Go to the Space Admin, and try to change to *Documentation theme*' you'll see that the theme will not change.

*Workaround*
Changing the Global Theme on your instance to "Default Theme" should do the trick of restoring the ability of configuring the sidebar of any space using Global Look and Feel.
fields.summary: Global Look and Feel Cannot be Applied to Individual Spaces when Documentation Theme is Set on Global

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce:

# Use Confluence 3.5.x
# Access its "User Directories"
# Integrate with Crowd or LDAP
# Trigger the synchronization process
# When the synchronization is completed, the page will refreshed itself
# Use Confluence 5.0.1
# Access its "User Directories"
# Integrate with Crowd or LDAP
# Trigger the synchronization process
# When the synchronization is completed, the page will not refreshed itself

h4. Expected Results:

Confluence should be able to refreshed the "User Directories" menu itself to show that the manually triggered synchronization is completed whether it is successful or not which was working fine on Confluence 3.5.x. 

h4. Notes

Please refer to the attached screencast files for reference.
fields.summary: User Directories Doesn't Refresh itself When Synchronization Completed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28979].
  {panel}

We added Personal Tasks into Weekly Status Meeting page.
Then we copied the page from one week to another and updated if tasks are done or not.
Obviously this was wrong design - we should have externalized the task list on it own page.
As side effect I got 60 personal tasks in my inbox top navigation drop down list -> but when opened I see only 1 line per task (even that one task exist in 5 pages with the same name). 
No idea what is best to change and if anything.
Not allowing the same personal task name for a person or something else.
fields.summary: Strange behavior of Confuence for Personal tasks with the same text

fields.description:
bug in Confluence version 5.0.2 which wasn`t in 4.3.3.
FireFox 3.6.23 (Ubuntu)
Scenario:
1) open Confluence page
2) "Edit"
3) "Insert->Wiki Markup"
4) write
*A*
5) "Insert"
Bold "A" appears at the start of the page but not in the place of cursor!
6) "Save"
Page is opened in read mode but bold "A" has disappeared 
Luckily problem is not present in Opera 11.60 I will use it as a workaround.

Terrible Translations on Manage Referrers Admin Page in German Confluence

fields.description:
When doing a space import, if a space permission in the export file refers to a group that is not present on the target, that permission is lost.

The expected behaviour is that the permission with the unknown group would remain, so that when the group is created the permissions should get resurrected.

This problem applies only to space permissions; content permissions already have the expected behaviour.
fields.summary: Space permissions for non-existent groups lost on space import

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create any page
# Add restrictions
# From view page click on the red padlock - remove all restrictions
# The red padlock is gone! Yay!
# Edit the page.

The restrictions button in the editor still says "Restrictions" with the red padlock. If you click it it brings up the dialog and there are no restrictions in it.

Reproduced in Chrome, FF. Don't think its a browser issue. 

It seems that the editor symbol is just using whatever the restricted state was before page loaded. That is, if the page was not restricted on load and the user applied restrictions and then edited the page, the editor status would say "Unrestricted" even though it was.
fields.summary: editor "Restricted" symbol does not update its status if restrictions are added/removed between page load and editor load

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28973].
  {panel}

Have a page with a bunch of Web Links that have the same URL for both Address and Link Text.

Try and update part of the URL using Find & Replace.

Only the Link Text is updated, resulting in a huge waste of time as the Address of each link now has to be updated by hand.

Would be good if the Find & Replace was able to identify that the text and the link are the same and then replace the text in the link as well.
fields.summary: Find and replace should work on the Address of Web Links

fields.description:
When translating the blueprints into german, you have the effect that umlauts that are contained in the instructional text are not saved.

See attachments for a visual "proof" of the problem:
- (a) go as administrator to change a global template
- (b) insert umlauts in the instructional text and elsewhere 
- (c) save the template, and edit it again: umlauts are lost in instructional text (but present in the "normal" template text
- (d) created pages from the template also do not contain the "missing" umlauts

This makes this feature nearly unusable in an internationalized environment, at least in germany.

h6. Test notes
# Test umlauts as well as Japanese/Russian characters on text placeholders on new and existing templates
# Insert variables into a template
# Verify the tested characters from step 1 characters show up on template insertion page too
fields.summary: Instructional text in Blueprints loses umlauts and other characters, when saving

fields.description:
Confluence looses indentation on copy-paste between code blocks.
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new document, create two code blocks. Insert indentated text in both of them:
{noformat}indentation
  works
    initially{noformat}
# Double click in the first code block -> Confluence selects the entire contents of the block.
# Press Ctrl+C
# Double click in the second code block -> Confluence selects the entire contents of the block.
# Press Ctrl+V

Expected result: the two code blocks are now indentical
Actual result: the second code block has the same text, but all of the indentation has been lost (and the font is different as well)

Confluence version: 4.1.9
Browser: Firefox 20
OS: Ubuntu 12.04
fields.summary: Copy-Paste doesn't work properly for code blocks
Ability to set max results for Content Report Table Macro

fields.description:
When trying to access the wiki in Chrome, a "Not Permitted" message sometimes appears, as can be seen in the attachment.

Another problem that comes up when we are able to access the wiki from Chrome, is that some pages would not open when selected, they would remain inactive.
fields.summary: Problems Opening Wiki in Chrome

fields.description:
We rely on the HTML Export function to deliver some Confluence pages in which we track the status of certain projects to our customers without having to grant them access to our Confluence. We recently upgraded Confluence from 4.3.6 to 5.1.1 and found out that the exported pages don't look like the original versions at all anymore. The exports from 4.3.6 were almost exact copies of the wiki pages, without the header, which was great.

I've tracked the problem down to wrong CSS: if I download the CSS that Confluence uses itself and insert it into the exports, everything looks fine.

I therefore conclude that Confluence exports the wrong CSS when exporting to HTML.
fields.summary: HTML Export delivers broken CSS
[Atlassian Answers] Pending answers reminder contains broken links

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce

fields.description:
I have had a stupendously shitty experience trying to import OnDemand data into local JIRA and Confluences. In this bug report I've documented the problems, what I think OnDemand developers could do to fix them *in bold*, and how I worked around them.


The problem is that after importing a Confluence Could export into Confluence (5.0.2), you'll find all jiraissues macros broken (note: I had previously migrated JIRA data to its new home):

!al0.png|thumbnail!

and a cryptic error in the logs:
{noformat}java.lang.NullPointerException: currentApplication
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:204)
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.trusted.TrustedApplicationsRequestFactory.<init>(TrustedApplicationsRequestFactory.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.trusted.TrustedAppsAuthenticationProviderPluginModule$1.getRequestFactory(TrustedAppsAuthenticationProviderPluginModule.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.ApplicationLinkRequestFactoryFactoryImpl.getApplicationLinkRequestFactory(ApplicationLinkRequestFactoryFactoryImpl.java:53)
{noformat}

With a bit of thinking one might figure out the error: the applinks are all broken, as is to be expected with the change of host.

h4. Suggested fix 1: improve the jiraissues error message when applinks have problems

So off we go to the applinks page:

!al1.png|thumbnail!

Applinks are not editable, because they are marked 'system'.

h4. Suggested fix 2: The Confluence Cloud exporter should remove the 'system' flag from the applink, so mortals can edit them

The 'system' flag can be removed manually in the database:

{code:sql}
mysql> select BANDANAKEY,BANDANAVALUE from BANDANA WHERE bandanakey like 'applinks.%.system';
+------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+
| BANDANAKEY                                                       | BANDANAVALUE          |
+------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+
| applinks.admin.30e7e368-6e59-357d-b986-d3374f95a205.system       | <string>true</string> |
| applinks.application.30e7e368-6e59-357d-b986-d3374f95a205.system | <string>true</string> |
+------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)
mysql> delete from BANDANA WHERE bandanakey like 'applinks.%.system';Query OK, 2 rows affected (0.01 sec)
{code}

Now I can edit the applink:

!al2.png|thumbnail!

And then my problems _really_ began.

For a start, the applink URL isn't editable:

!al3.png|thumbnail!

(Questionable design decision here: sure, changing the URL to a different JIRA would break everything, but most times it's the _same JIRA_, just under a different URL.)

So anyway, let's edit the URL in the database, first by finding the applink ID, finding the applink's properties, then changing the URLs:


{code:sql}
mysql> SELECT BANDANAVALUE FROM BANDANA WHERE BANDANAKEY = 'applinks.global.application.ids';
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| BANDANAVALUE                                                           |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| <list>
  <string>30e7e368-6e59-357d-b986-d3374f95a205</string>
</list> |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)
mysql> update BANDANA set BANDANAVALUE=replace(BANDANAVALUE, 'somecompany.atlassian.net', 'jira.somecompany.com') where BANDANAKEY like '%30e7e368-6e59-357d-b986-d3374f95a205%.url';
Query OK, 2 rows affected (0.01 sec)
Rows matched: 2  Changed: 2  Warnings: 0
{code}

(and whatever you do, don't change the applink's title--even though it contains an incorrect URL too--the title is embedded in hundreds of Confluence page jiraissues macros. That is a job for bulk-rewriting.)

After a Confluence restart, the applink appears with the correct link.

!al4.png|thumbnail!

Switching to the 'Outgoing Authentication' tab, it claims to be in Status: Configured. Just to be sure let's disable and re-enable it. Clicking 'Disable' is easy enough, but then:

!al5.png|thumbnail!

Where is the 'Enable' link??

This is a UI bug (affects Firefox 16.0.1, Chrome 26.0.1410.63) - the link is actually there, and can be seen by clicking on the last form element (the timeout field) and pressing tab:

!al6.png|thumbnail!

h4. Suggested fix #3: Atlassian should use a sane, modern JS library that sizes popups appropriately

So we click 'Enable', and:

!al7.png|thumbnail!

{noformat}java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationsFilter$CertificateServerImpl.writeCertificate(TrustedApplicationsFilter.java:201)
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationsFilter.doFilter(TrustedApplicationsFilter.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.AbstractBootstrapHotSwappingFilter.doFilter(AbstractBootstrapHotSwappingFilter.java:30)
{noformat}

"But hang on", I hear you say, "why are you trying to fix this obviously borked applink? Just delete it and start again". No such luck:

!al8.png|thumbnail!
(and, in case you were wondering, it breaks the same way if you don't change the URLs in the database as I did)

"Okay, what about that 'Upgrade application link' button?" It dies with the JS equivalent of a NullPointerException:

!al9.png|thumbnail!

So we're left with an applink we can't fix and can't delete.

Fortunately, Googling the exception brings up [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Cannot+Add+JIRA+as+a+Trusted+Application+Due+to+Multiple+Trusted+Applications], which points to the cause: the #@#%! Confluence Cloud exporter has erased all the {{KEYSTORE}} records, which trustedapps depends on:

{code:sql}
mysql> select * from KEYSTORE;
Empty set (0.00 sec)
{code}

The KB article points to [CONF-11074|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11074], which helpfully includes a JSP to recreate the KEYSTORE.

So I run the JSP, which populates my KEYSTORE table with a public/private keypair, and now - hurrah - I can enable Outgoing Authentication. After a restart, the jiraissues macros that rely on the applink work too.

h3. Suggested fix #4: if you have to wipe the KEYSTORE table, replace its values with something else!
Don't just leave them blank when doing so results in a broken, undeletable, unfixable applink. Create a new unique keypair using the code from the CONF-11074 JSP and put the keys in KEYSTORE.

Thank you for reading.
fields.summary: Keystore table is empty post migrating from Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28952].
  {panel}

The following article from Confluence knowledge base is talking about a way to improve the notify watcher feature of Confluence. Since any customization like this is not supportted by Atlassian, it would be nice if this improvemnet is implemented into the feature release of Confluence by default. Ideally, the Confluence admin should be able to turn on or off this by space.

* [How to uncheck Notify watchers check box on Confluence editor by default|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+uncheck+Notify+watchers+check+box+on+Confluence+editor+by+default]

Thanks

tito
fields.summary: Improving the Notify watcher feature
Exposing Selective Wiki content to 3rd party

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# using FF, insert page layouts on a page
# insert a body macro
# insert a body macro inside the body macro in step 2
# insert text inside the body macro in step 3
# drag from right to left to select the text inserted in step 4, continue dragging so you go outside the bounds of the body macro

attempt to click inside the editor. There is no cursor.

h4. Workaround (kind of)
If the amount of content is such that the user can vertically scroll inside the editor, then the cursor will be restored after scrolling. Otherwise, the user has to cancel and return to the editor.

Reproduce on FF
Could not be reproduced in IE9, Chrome. Probably a FF specific issue
fields.summary: editor freezes when user drags selection outside body macro when page layouts are applied

fields.description:
In response to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28724 the quick search placeholder text has been modified to inform uses whenever the search will only apply to the current space (This happens when documentation theme is enabled and configured to apply searches to the current space)

With the new placeholder, the text no longer fits when the quick search field is resized to its minimum width. (Simply resize the browser window to < 1280 pixels).

The placeholder will be clipped for all the following strings:
* Search this space
* Den Bereich durchsuchen
* Rechercher dans cet espace

This is an issue for Firefox and IE

See attachment for current behaviour.
fields.summary: Quick search placeholder text is clipped when documentation theme is enabled to search current space
Hyperlink Tool Doesn't Always Work
Anonymous space permission allows non-permissioned groups to access space, when global permissions are set to prevent anonymous access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28945].
  {panel}

On Chrome 25, I consistently get only a narrow 150 pixel high edit window.

If I try it on Chrome 25 from another computer, I get the full edit window.

I've cleared all cookies and browsing history on the Chrome browser in question, but this still doesn't the fix the problem. 

Any ideas?
fields.summary: Confluence edit space limited to 150 pixels

fields.description: When using the Confluence default theme, if you're on a space admin page and click 'Configure sidebar' in the sidebar, then click 'Add link', instead of a popup appearing, nothing happens. The same sequence works properly if you are on a non-admin page.
fields.summary: Configure sidebar functionality is broken when on Space Admin pages
Date Picker do not have the right format

fields.description:
When Office Document title contains certain alphanumeric characters, for example something similar to below:
- "blah"
- blah"
- Michael & Vincent

Editing an attachment in Office will fail as the alphanumeric character is converted in the URL, for example:
{code}" or &{code}

You may also see an error similar to below:
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/114407/q3eql936nqaazji/screenshot000.jpg!
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/114407/72idls7gthi3c87/screenshot001.jpg!


Same issue occurred when trying to "Edit Document" - embedded Office document in Confluence page via Office Connector macro.

h5. Workaround:
Rename the page title to exclude the alphanumeric characters
fields.summary: Edit In Office fail for attachments when contains certain alpha numeric characters
If personal spaces are disabled globally, there shouldn't be a "personal spaces" tab in the space directory
Confluence should have proper UI to add links to headings and anchors on other pages.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page with two email addresses on it: *helpdesk@something.com* and *helpdesk@something.us*
# Build/rebuild indexes
# Search for help*@something.com
# Search for help*@something.us

In the first search, as expected, results are displayed, however in the second case they are not:

- !dotcom.jpeg!
- !dotus.jpeg!

Moreover, searching for just the domain like: *@something.com* does not return any result.
fields.summary: Searching for e-mail addresses not working as expected

fields.description:
If you use a section and inside this section place twe columsn beside each other, online this looks ok. However if you export this page to Word using the build in Word exporter the columns are placed below each other. This is not correct.

To reproduce this bug: Insert section, insert column inside this section, inside second column below first one. Type some text in both columns. Save edits. Look at finished page. This is ok, shows two columns horizontally beside one another. Export to Word using the standard export -> Two columns not horizontally next to each other but one above the other, vertically ,which is not what you use columns for in the first place.
fields.summary: Export of horizontal placed columns inside a section appear vertically in an export to Word.
User Profile picture in user menu is missing alt text

fields.description:
The Confluence 5 sidebar requires a page-specific style:
{code}
<style>.ia-fixed-sidebar, .ia-splitter-left {width: 285px;}.theme-default .ia-splitter #main {margin-left: 285px;}.acs-side-bar {visibility: hidden;}</style>
{code}

Where the 285 gets changed when people drag it.

This is currently being included on doctheme pages and the dashboard.

This style tag is included in the IE limit of 31 style or link tags, which we are always running into, so it is essential to limit its inclusion to pages on which it is relevant.
fields.summary: Sidebar styles included without sidebar

fields.description:
When an external resource(e.g. http://foo.com/image.jpeg) is used as the source of an image tag, if the external resource returns a 401 response code and sets a WWW-Authenticate header then the browsers standard 'Basic authentication' dialogue will pop up within on the confluence page.
While this is standard (and expected) browser behavior it could confuse users and be used in phishing attacks.
fields.summary: External image sources can trigger a basic authentication dialogue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28931].
  {panel}

I have asked following feature below through email.

And I have a reply it would be much better to add this on jira.
Please check this feature for your later update.


Thanks,

Sungjoon Im


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
I have a question relating sending group email when someone create or change page.

Is there any way to send email to multiple people by adding a group name?
As far as I know, to use email sending function should add all the people one by one.

I want to let my co-workers know what is going on with email sending. But to do that, there are too many people to add.
fields.summary: New Feature: Sending group email by adding a group name
Paste issue with Chrome on Ubuntu
Simpler way of creating a new office document shared from Confluence
Support command+shift+z as undo keyboard shortcut in the editor on OSX
Show full page title in tooltip for link suggestions

fields.description:
Create a page with the following structure:

Code block (i.e. created with \{code macro)
Paragraph
Code block

Start to drag the 1st code block.

Cancel the drag by pressing the ESC key.

Now the "4-arrow" cursor still appears when mousing over either code block title, but neither code block can actually be dragged.
fields.summary: Code blocks become immovable

fields.description:
When dragging a code block to move it to a different location, the insertion cursor jumps all over the page.

E.g. see the attached screenshot, where the code block is dragged to the top of the page but the cursor has jumped to the bottom.  In this example, if I moved the code block a couple of pixels up or down then the cursor would jump back to a location under the code block.  Move it another couple of pixels and it would jump back down to the bottom.

Expected behaviour is that the insertion point should be approximately underneath the dragged code block at all times, otherwise repositioning is just a random game of chance.
fields.summary: Drag-n-drop code block insertion point jumps around page

fields.description:
I had 6 pieces of text in a page:

Paragraph 1
Code block 1 (i.e. \{code\})
Paragraph 2
Code block 2
Paragraph 3
Code block 3

I was editing the 2nd code block, but the formatting kept changing from monospace to non-monospace (see Bug CONF-28769) so eventually I decided to delete all the text within the code block and re-paste the content.

I highlighted all the text in Code block 2 and pressed Backspace, expecting that this would delete the text and leave the cursor in an empty code block ready for pasting.

Instead, code block 2 was completely removed and code block 3 jumped above Paragraph 3 so I was left with a page looking like this:

Paragraph 1
Code block 1
Paragraph 2
Code block 3
Paragraph 3
fields.summary: Code blocks unexpectedly being removed, and moving around page

fields.description:
During the evaluation-migration for the latest confluence we moved to a new server and observed wrong links (pointing to the old server:port) in the workbox-notifications.
The email-notifications displayed correct links to the new confluence-site.

Also: this behaviour was just observed from "administrator" to me ... when I notified "administrator", his workbox-notifications had the correct links.

History:
* server "old" hosts our production-site with confluence 3.5.2 on port 8081
* tried successfully a migration (Backup + Restore) to the server "new" (also version 3.5.2, but with an evaluation licence)
* on server "new" confluence was update to 5.1.1 (with 4.3.5 in between, since it was suggested to update to each major release), now using the default port 8090
* confluence 5.1.1 on "new:8090" runs fine - except for workbox-notification-links still pointing to "old:8081"
fields.summary: After migration to a new server and updating to 5.1.1, some workbox-notifications point to the old server

fields.description:
I created a list of definitions with the acronym in bold, then went back to add a sentence above the list.

Even though the Bold style is not selected (see attachment -1), the typed text has the bold style applied (see attachment -2).

The editor seems to be applying the style for the following element (the first acronym in the list) to the new text, but hasn't updated the style toggles to reflect this.
fields.summary: Applied text style out of sync with style buttons

fields.description:
I was importing content from JSP Wiki, which also uses \{\{ to indicate monospaced text.

Confluence doesn't recognise \{\{ in the pasted text, so I had to manually replace the \{\{ that was already there with another \{\{.

Doing this by selecting the existing \{\{ and typing \{\{ fails, because the selected text is not overtyped - instead the WYSIWYG editor ADDS 2 more braces so the text ends up being \{\{\{\{.

Replacing a selection with characters typed at the keyboard is basic text editing functionality that's been around for at least 20 years.  Breaking this behaviour is pretty poor.
fields.summary: Overtyping braces doesn't work

fields.description:
Position the cursor in front of a table (as per attached screenshot).

Press Return.

Expected behaviour is that a new line would be inserted where the cursor is positioned in front of the table (duh), but instead a new line is inserted at the top of the page (wtf?).
fields.summary: Pressing Return inserts new line at top of page instead of at cursor

fields.description:
When accessing Confluence 5.1.1 via Firefox Mobile for Android, the browser isn't recognised as a mobile browser and is only offered the desktop version of the application.

This does not occur when using the stock Android browser on the same phone, hence I suspect a user agent validation problem.

User agent identifies itself as:
"Mozilla/5.0 (Android; Mobile; rv:20.0) Gecko/20.0 Firefox/20.0"
fields.summary: Firefox Mobile on Android not served Confluence Mobile UI
Support for Espresso issue links
TOC macro display broken in left panel of documentation theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28910].
  {panel}

Case:
There are 2 LDAP directories set up in Confluence which 1 for domain A and another 1 for domain B.

However, there are duplicate username such as jsmith located in both domain and they are not the same user. For eg. 
User Directory A configured with Domain A: jsmith(John Smith)
User Directory B configured with Domain B: jsmith(Jonathan Smith)

In Confluence authentication and based on the rule of multiple directories, the first occurrence of the user across the directories would be use for authentication and login into Confluence. Assuming Directory A is on top of Directory B, whenever Jonathan Smith from Domain B try to login, it would use the one from Domain A for authentication. In the end, the customer would be rejected due to wrong password or missing due to being point to a different domain.

Some solution should be implemented to avoid different user with same username are having conflict on login into Confluence.

Current Workaround:
* Use a different attribute for username such as email during the setup of second directory in Confluence. Thus, the users from second domain are login with email address.
* Rename the conflicting username in the LDAP server before the setup of second user directory in Confluence.
fields.summary: Better handling of authentication in duplicate username across different LDAP domain

fields.description:
1. I have a group of users called confluence-devel
2. I add ‘User List’ macro to a page

Expected:
List of users is showed.

Obtained:
Error rendering macro 'userlister' : com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.conditions.PeopleDirectoryEnabledCondition.setSettingsManager(Lcom/atlassian/confluence/setup/settings/SettingsManager;)V
fields.summary: Userlister macro does not render user group properly
Remove unused database tables

fields.description:
1. Create a page with Page Properties (see example below) 2. Add a JIRA issue link as one of the values 3. Export to PDF or Word -> File contains an error (see attachment) -- Example Confluence Data -- feature
JIRA ID Imtech JIRA 37936ce2-8a45-3ac2-a14b-04c3cb819a19 SDHELPDESK-135
-- Error -- Error: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 6, column 37. Parser message: Unexpected close tag ; expected . at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [6,37]

fields.summary: This DEBUG message should be WARN level - it indicates that the mail queue did not flush and mail will not be sent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28905].
  {panel}

Disclaimer: I'm not sure if the problem lies in OpenOffice, the WebDAV Launcher, the Office Connector, or Confluence itself.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Attach an XLS (not XLSX) document to a Confluence page, add the Office Excel macro to the page with that attached document.
# Click the Edit Document link, enter the username/password details in OpenOffice when prompted.
# Make a change and save the document.

h3. Expected results
The document is saved back to Confluence and the edit is visible when refreshing the Confluence page.

h3. Actual results
OpenOffice pops up with an error: 

{quote}
Error saving the document <document name>:
The object cannot be created in directory
https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/confluence/editinword/<pageid>/attachments/.
{quote}

The same applies when using it to edit Word documents.

h3. Workaround
Using OpenOffice 3.2.0 (which can be downloaded from [here|http://archive.apache.org/dist/incubator/ooo/stable/3.2.0/]) allows the files to be saved back to Confluence.
fields.summary: Unable to save Word/Excel documents back to Confluence in current OpenOffice (3.4.1) under Mac OS X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28903].
  {panel}

You know what would be GREAT?

-  Adding user presence to page info at the top of each page.
-  Adding user presence status icon to comments  

e.g.(in screenshot attached) Added by [author][im presence status icon], Last edited by [editor][im status] on 12 Apr, 2013 (view change)
fields.summary: Improve IM Presence with in page IM Status Icon

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28902].
  {panel}

When adding a Jira Issue to a Confluence page, If you select "View in JIRA" in the edit page, the issue opens correctly, but If you click on the link in the page view (i.e. not editing)... the link is broken. It has left off the Context Path (in my case /jira)...

So when opening from the Edit view, I get the correct URL 

http://jira.transmedia-technology.com:8080/jira/browse/STFP-12

but when opening from the Page view, I get this URL

http://jira.transmedia-technology.com:8080/browse/STFP-12
fields.summary: Confluence JIRA Issues Macro link broken on rendered page

fields.description:
If you create a very simple user macro (with no macro body) that accepts a text parameter, if the text in that parameter contains a left curly brace ({), it will not render correctly in the editor.

If the text is only "{" it can fail to render entirely, only showing a spinner logo.  If you enter something like "test{here" it will only display everything after the {, so "here" in this case. 

It renders fine *within* the macro browser when you Preview it, but when you Save it and go back to the Editor window, that is where it fails to render correctly.

Either there appears there is a problem with code on the server that creates the image thumbnail for the macro placeholder, or something in TinyMCE is not properly handling the character before it sends it up to the server (guessing the latter).
fields.summary: Curly left brace { in user macro breaks rendering

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# In a Confluence 4.3.2, download the LaTeX plugin from [Atlassian MarketPlaceZhttps://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.latex.confluence.macro-latex]
# Upload the plugin in Confluence.
# Create a page, and try to add the LaTeX inline.
# Write something there, and save.
# You'll see that you won't be able to save the page.
fields.summary: LaTeX plugin from Atlassian, doesn't allow to save a page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28899].
  {panel}

There are a lot of situations where attachments need to be used instead of wiki pages.  And in some cases, folks will put links to these attachments on wiki pages.

However, when browsing, it's cumbersome to have to download the files to view them (depending on the browser you are using and whether or not it has a preview option for that type of document).

But since Confluence is rendering the link anyway, perhaps it could make the default target of the link be the viewfile viewer (which has a download link in the bottom left).  Alternately, clicking a link to an attachment could have a popup similar to in the editor, where it gives you the option to either download the file or navigate to the viewfile viewer for it.

This could potentially be something at the global and/or space default level to enable this mode or not, since some installations/spaces might prefer to have direct links.  Or it could even be an option on the link itself (default action on click = preview/download).

(My apologies if this is a duplicate, I tried searching and didn't find anything that exactly met what I was hoping for).
fields.summary: Global or Space option for attachment links to go to viewfile preview by default (or at least have a popup option)
Support MySQL 5.6.x
After entering a hyperlink in a page and verifying that it works, the link is replaced with "nofollow" in <a href> when I save.

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA issue in JIRA e.g. TEST-2
# Insert the issue in Confluence page (Insert > JIRA Issue)
# Here's the result:
!issue.png!
# Move the JIRA issue from one project to another. For example, now it becomes: TESAT-4
# Navigate to the same Confluence page where previously the JIRA Issue was inserted and here's the result:
!issue2.png!
Noticed that the issue summary is gone and the issue key was not updated to reflect the changes.

This link will show the details as well - https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/601243/Moving%20Jira%20issue.pdf

The issue occurred because the macro stores the key as a whole:
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="key">TEST-2</ac:parameter>
{code}
Hence, when TEST-2 is moved to TESAT-4 (moved from project TEST to TESAT), then the link will remain as TEST-2 and without issue summary in the JIRA macro.
fields.summary: JIRA Macro did not get updated when an issue is moved from one project to another
Provide an option to turn off JIRA Macro caching via UI

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Access Confluence using IE
# Upload an image to Confluence e.g. Maru.JPG
# Embedded it in Confluence page using Gallery macro
# Click on the image > Right Click > Rename the file > Save
# The file is saved as a file instead of an image with jpg extension

h5. Workaround:
# Navigate to Tools > Attachments > Click on the image Properties > Change the file name to Maru.jpg (lowercase)
# Repeat step #4
# The file is saved to the machine as an image with jpg enxtension

OR

Use Firefox or Chrome instead which do not have the same problem
fields.summary: IE does not recognized image extension in uppercase when renaming/saving a gallery image

fields.description:
There are 2 issues we have encountered with Confluence 4.1.3.
1. In the editor: when clicking the Preview button and then the Edit
button to return to editing, the page breaks and all you can see is the
heading and a few text controls. The page won't scroll. A sort-of fix: You
can do a "find" (in the browser; not in the editor) to grab certain buttons
on the page (for example searching for "Save" allows you to see and click
that button at the bottom of the editor), but then the top is cut off still
without the ability to scroll to it.

2. The text won't wrap. When putting text into a column and setting the
column width it seemed as though the column width was disregarded so the
text would all fit and wouldn't wrap.
https://wiki.getjive.com/display/CS/Failover+Extension+For+Line+Dial+Plan is
an example. We found a fix by doing a soft return on the paragraphs to make them fit to the desired width, but it's a clunky solution.
fields.summary: Wiki editor problems

fields.description:
This scenario will happen if enable both HTTP(8090) and HTTPS(8433) and 'Server Base Url' is set to HTTP.

[Reproduce procedures]
1. Access confluence via HTTPS
2. Click menu 'Space' at the top menu 
3. At 'Space Directory' page,  click any of the menu at the left side eg. All spaces etc. then click link to any of spaces. you'll go to that space but with HTTP.

** If 'Server Base Url' is set to HTTPS, this problem will not occurred.
fields.summary: SSL Enabled but some link point to http:// instead of https://

fields.description:
PreReq: Confluence instance running behind SSL.

1. Attach a WMA file to page.
2. Use {multimedia:name=the_file.wma}

Security alert will popup and may / may not load Object per security setup.

We run in a very large regulated corporate environment, and security settings are completely out of the users hands.  IE is the corporate browser unfortunately, since they can control company-wide security more easily.

It would be nice if com.atlassian.renderer.embedded.EmbeddedWindowsMedia could detect the protocol of the request.  If host is behind SSL, make an SSL request to: http://activex.microsoft.com/activex/controls/mplayer/en/nsmp2inf.cab#Version=5,1,52,701
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro does not respect SSL with WMA files while in Internet Explorer
Reduce Public Documentation Page Sizes (Slowness)
Open in Office macro

fields.description:
This is the list I start with in the Confluence editor: * Level 1 ** Level 1.1 This produces the correct HTML output: {code}
  • Level 1
    • Level 1.1
{code} Notice that the Level 1 appears after the nested
    . Then I open the editor again and enter some text after the list. Not IN the list itself, but really under the list. In this case I put my cursor after Level 1.1 and press enter 3 times. I write some text there and then delete it until my cursor is again after Level 1.1. Saving this apparent null operation will give me this faulty output: {code}
    • Level 1
      • Level 1.1
    {code} When viewing this page, it seems to render OK. But when you export this page to PDF, the nested
      will have the same indentation as the level 1
        . My explanation may make it seem this doesn't happen very often, but it does. Users often delete text after a list until the cursor is right after the last item in the list. This demo was reproduced in Internet Explorer 8 and Chrome.

fields.description:
If you have a page title that contains dash (*-*) or apostrophe (*'*) (possibly other characters as well), then the Move page dialogue will display these characters in page title as HTML entities.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page with dash (*-*) and apostrophe (*'*) in the title
# Switch language to German
# Move the page, notice the title of the dialogue


(i) This issue does not seem to be present in 5.x.
fields.summary: Move page dialog - page title displayed wrong when language is German

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28873].
  {panel}

When editing an attachment using "Edit in Office" in the attachment screen, the office application may save its working file every X minutes based on "autorecovery" option parameter set by the individual users. The default is probably 5 to 10 minutes, but some users have set it as small as 30 seconds.

The office integration uploads the file every time when there is a new time stamp, not only when the content was actually changed by the user. 

So, while the user has the file open for editing for some time and goes to lunch, he has many new versions created in Confluence although nothing has been changed.


This eats up resources, both disk space and network traffic, unnecessarily.

Suggestions:
a) do not upload the auto-recover files at all, but only when the office application has been ended (or the Save button pressed explicitly)
b) only create a new version if anything has changed in the file. There is no need to create a new version which has no change compared to the previous version. This would be in line with the behavior of saving pages in the editor.   (I don't know whether some bits within the file might have changed due to different time stamp? This would make it a bit difficult)
fields.summary: Office Integration saves every auto-recover version
Non-sysadmin should not be allowed to change Encoding

fields.description:
The following error _Failure when converting editor format to storage format._ can be reproduced with Confluence 4.3.2 as follows:
# Send an email to Confluence (any space that can receive emails).
# View this email in Confluence and copy the ID (e.g. 20152482 for email at http://wiki/display/TS/mail/20152482)
# Create or edit a page and insert a link to this email by inserting \[$IDOFMAIL\] (e.g. \[$20152482\], as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF35/Linking+to+Mail).
# Try to save the page - the error will show up. Any page containing such links from older versions will display properly, but will fail at the next edit.
fields.summary: Failure when converting editor format to storage format with links to emails on page

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 'user1' in the Internal Directory
# Create 'group1' in the Internal Directory
# Create a 'Read only with Local groups' connection to an LDAP directory which contains 'user1'
# Create an admin user in the LDAP, in the group confluence-administrators
# Log in to Confluence with the LDAP administrator account
# Disable the internal directory
# Create 'group1' - this will create a local group in the LDAP directory in Confluence (not in the LDAP itself)
# At this point you should have:
-- Two directories in cwd_directory
-- Two user1 records in cwd_user
-- Two group1 records in cwd_group
-- Two records in cwd_membership linking each user1 and group1 together in the correct directory
# Re-enable the Internal Directory
# Move the LDAP directory to the top of the list
# Go to group1 in Confluence - you should now be on the Group Members page and you should see all users in the group
# Click to delete user1
#- Observe that the screen appears to refresh but the user still appears in the list.
# Check the database again. You will now have:
-- Two directories in cwd_directory
-- Two user1 records in cwd_user
-- Two group1 records in cwd_group
-- *One record* in cwd_membership linking user1 and group1 together in the Internal directory only.
# This appears to be occurring because the user is successfully deleted from group1 in the LDAP directory, but still exists in group1 in the Internal directory. The list of members appears to be built from all active directories, whereas the delete function appears to only operate on the top directory.

Expected behaviour here is unclear. Should hitting 'delete' in the Group Members page remove the user from that group in all active directories? Or should the Group Members page only display the memberships in current directory?

h3. Workarounds
# Disable the directory that is not in use, so the user only exists in one directory
# Remove the user from one directory
fields.summary: Multiple users in the same group in multiple directories appears to disallow the user being removed from the group from the Group Members page. The user is successfully removed from the group in the top directory only.
